conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D interior: walls have clear height/thickness, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose the plan.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners and clear floor-vs-wall separation; view is slightly elevated/angled with minimal distortion and a clean cutaway.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (kitchen/dining left, living center, bedrooms right, bath bottom-center, laundry/closets bottom-left), but some internal wall lengths/partition placements and several opening placements/sizes appear simplified relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (dining table, sofas, beds, kitchen counters/appliances, toilet/sink/tub) and generally placed in the correct rooms at reasonable scale.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with consistent materials and a clean presentation; lighting is adequate but some openings and thin partitions blend into the wall color, reducing immediate clarity.

detected_errors.description: Door/window opening locations and proportions appear simplified and may not fully match the 2D plan (some openings look missing or shifted).
Minor-to-moderate layout proportional drift in internal partitions (hall/bath/closet segmentation and some wall run lengths differ from the 2D plan).
Some wall segments/partitions are visually ambiguous due to similar tones and thin geometry, slightly reducing structural readability.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric walls and furnishings, with only modest discrepancies in internal partition proportions and opening placement versus the 2D plan.
